security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate research skill that provides web search and code context retrieval via Exa API. Contains Python helper scripts for query optimization and research workflows. All network calls are to documented Exa API endpoints. No malicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Search the web and code with Exa AI
content.value_statement: Finding current information and working code examples takes significant time and effort. This skill provides unified access to web search and code context retrieval through Exa AI, enabling efficient technical research with both articles and implementation examples.
actual_capabilities: Search the web for articles, news, and documentation on any topic
Find code examples and implementation patterns from open source repositories
Combine web and code research for comprehensive understanding
Optimize search queries for better results with built-in analysis
Run automated multi-step research workflows for common patterns
limitations: Requires Exa API key to function
Results depend on Exa API availability and data quality
Cannot access private or behind-paywall content
Code context results are limited by token settings

use_cases.title: Learn a new framework
use_cases.description: Get overview, examples, and best practices for any technology quickly.

use_cases.title: Solve technical problems
use_cases.description: Find solutions to specific errors or implementation challenges with working code.

use_cases.title: Compare solutions
use_cases.description: Research multiple tools or libraries with side-by-side comparisons and code.

prompt_templates.title: Quick web search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search the web for {topic} latest information 2025 using exa_web_search with 10 results and deep search type.

prompt_templates.title: Code examples
prompt_templates.prompt: Find code examples for {framework} {feature} using exa_get_code_context with 5000 tokens.

prompt_templates.title: Combined research
prompt_templates.prompt: Research {topic} by first searching the web for overview, then finding code examples. Use deep search and 8000 tokens for code.

prompt_templates.title: Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare {solution_a} and {solution_b} by searching for comparison articles and getting code examples for each.

output: Web search found 10 articles on Next.js authentication patterns
Code search retrieved 5000 tokens of implementation examples
Combined results include JWT, OAuth, and session-based auth code

best_practices: Use deep search type (type="deep") for comprehensive research tasks
Include the current year in queries to get latest information
Combine web search with code search for complete understanding
anti_patterns: Using overly broad queries without specific technology or framework names
Skipping the year in queries and getting outdated information
Relying only on web search without checking working code examples

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for web and code search.

faq.question: What are the result limits?
faq.answer: Web search returns up to 50 results. Code context supports 1000 to 50000 tokens.

faq.question: How do I integrate this skill?
faq.answer: Import exa_web_search and exa_get_code_context from servers.exa module.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Queries are sent to Exa API. No local data is collected or stored.

faq.question: Why are my results empty?
faq.answer: Check your Exa API key is set. Try more specific search terms.

faq.question: How is this different from regular search?
faq.answer: Combines web articles with actual code examples from open source projects.
